Literature Review: Hate crimes, or bias-motivated crimes, have become a significant societal issue in the 21st century, particularly as political rhetoric has increasingly targeted marginalized groups. This literature review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of knowledge regarding hate crimes, focusing on legal frameworks, trends in victimization, characteristics of perpetrators and victims, and the effectiveness of interventions.
